conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and how it will be directed into containers D, E, or F.
Baffles are designed to redirect the flow of liquid.
The direction of the liquid flow can be seen in the image, where the liquid from A, B, and C is directed into specific containers.
Baffles create paths for the liquid to follow, and the liquid will flow into the container aligned with the path created by the baffles.
Liquid from A is directed into container D.
Liquid from B is directed into container E.
Liquid from C is directed into container F.
Determine the container for each source: A into D, B into E, C into F.
Conclusion: Liquid from A will flow into container D, liquid from B will flow into container E, liquid from C will flow into container F.
